snippet: An appellate court cut the bail for Anna Gristina by nearly 90 percent, saying the original $2 million was “unreasonable and an abuse of discretion.”
abstract: Appellate Division of New York State Supreme Court reduces bail for Anna Gristina, who was arrested for allegedly running a prostitution service on the Upper East Side of Manhattan, to $125,000 from $1 million.
lead_paragraph: An appellate court cut the bail for Anna Gristina by nearly 90 percent, saying the original $2 million was “unreasonable and an abuse of discretion.”

headline.seo: Bail Reduced for Anna Gristina, Reputed East Side Madam
headline.main: Woman Said to Be a Madam Wins a Big Cut in Her Bail
headline.print_headline: Woman Said To Be Madam Wins Big Cut In Her Bail
